title: Malvirà 2015  Roero
description: Aromas of tropical fruit and white peach carry over to the creamy palate along with ripe Granny Smith apple, candied lemon rind and a ginger note. Fresh acidity lifts the rather rich finish.

title: Castorani 2012 Amorani  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo)
description: This offers aromas of plum, violet, leather and a whiff of dark baking spice. The juicy palate doles out ripe black cherry, blackberry jam, star anise and a hint of orange zest framed in lithe tannins.

title: Caven 2009 Al Carmine Inferno  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: This mountain Nebbiolo opens with aromas of forest floor, violet, menthol and a whiff of scorched earth. The taut palate offers dried black cherry, ground pepper and star anise alongside austere tannins that grip the finish.

title: Château Escot 2012  Médoc
description: This is a ripe wine that also has a light touch. That gives black-currant fruit and tannins along with a poised structure and attractive crisp acidity. The Cabernet Sauvignon fruit dominates while also giving the wine a dry core. Drink this stylish wine from 2019.

title: Bogle 2014 Merlot (California)
description: Nicely behaved and well balanced, this gentle wine offers medium body, fresh plum flavors and a texture that's smooth and lightly tannic. The color is relatively deep and aromas are fruity, with a touch of earth.

title: Château Monbrison 2014  Margaux
description: The wine is dry and firm with a serious amount of new wood and spice. That seems to have swamped the fruit at this stage. There is enough fruit weight there to develop as the wine matures. Drink from 2022.

title: Brophy Clark 2014 Whale Rock Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Candied cherry, crushed fennel, rosebuds, baking spice and baked blackberry show on the sweet-smelling nose of this single-vineyard Zin. Anise arises first on the palate, then more candied red-cherry elements and herbs. The texture is not complex, but the overall experience is nicely varied.

title: Calheiros Cruz 2014 Tinto Red (Douro)
description: This wine is fruity, rich and well structured, with tannins that are already integrated with the fruit. Juicy and fruity, it is going to be delicious as it develops. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Fonréaud 2014 La Légende  (Haut-Médoc)
description: This is the second wine of Listrac's Chateau Fonréaud. A blend of half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is rich and juicy. Blackberry fruits are shot through with acidity and balanced with generous tannins that are softening well. With its juicy acidity and fruity aftertaste, it will be ready to drink from late 2017.

title: Vino 2015 Rosso Red (Washington)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (70%) and Sangiovese pops with fruit-forward aromas of blue fruit, red currant and herb. It packs a mouthful of elegant, somewhat angular, fresh fruit flavors, bringing a whole lot of appeal and tapering slightly toward the finish.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: Perhaps still showing a bit of bottle shock, this may well prove to be a late bloomer, as is often the case with Eyrie wines, both white and red. It's tight and unyielding, showing a mix of gooseberry, green apple and unripe pineapple fruit. There is plenty of room for improvement with further bottle age, and the balance is there; it just feels constrained, even after being open for 24 hours.

title: The Insider 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and red cherry show on the nose of this bottling. Quite wound up and reductive at first, it needs time to open up past the tarry entrance. Dense boysenberry, cedar, leather and peppery spice hang from a chalky structure, presenting an impressively complete package at a fair price.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2015 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Bright, cheery whiffs of sugar cookie crumbs and Meyer lemon zest perfume this sunny off-dry Riesling. On the palate, sweet-tart tangerine mingles into more savory notes of bees wax and pollen. The finish is brisk but refreshing.

title: Silvan Ridge 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This smooth and detailed wine mixes tart red fruits with earthy, lightly charred flavors. The robust tannins carry notes of espresso beans and dark chocolate. It will need decanting and/or aeration to bring it all into proper balance.

title: Silvara 2014 Malbec (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The oak is at the fore initially, with aromas of toast, char and exotic spice out in front of green herbs and purple fruit that become more prominent over time. The fruit flavors are sweet and sappy, with abundant toasty and vanilla accents throughout. It delivers enjoyment, but fruit and barrel seem to tussle a bit at times.

title: La Mejorada 2011 Villalar Oro Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: Earthy slightly rustic aromas suggest compost along with ripe berry fruits. This feels wide and heavy, with an extracted mildly tannic mouthfeel. Prune and blackberry flavors don't see much acidic push, and thus this Tempranillo finishes blocky, ripe and chunky.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Wine & Soul 2014 Quinta da Manoella Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This full and fruity wine is solid with supporting tannins and a smoky character, with flavors of wood aging still there. Let it develop and take its time. Drink from 2020.

title: White Rose 2014 Winemaker's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The house style seems to favor wines with plenty of stem flavors, high acids and moderate alcohol—all of which are evident here. Flavors of rhubarb and sour cherry pull together in midpalate, with medium concentration and tangy highlights of citrus.

title: Château Renard Mondesir 2011  Fronsac
description: Produced from a 17-acre vineyard, dominated by Merlot, this is the top wine of Château Renard. It is structured and firm with tannins and dense concentration that will probably remain with this rich wine as it matures. Drink from 2018.

title: College Cellars 2014 Les Collines Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Coming from a site best known for its Syrah, this wine brings high-toned aromas of violets, herb and dark fruit. The black-fruit flavors are rich yet supple, with fine-grained but occasionally toothy tannins providing support. Mocha flavors linger on the finish. It's a bit oak heavy but by and large carries it.

title: Colomé 2013 Estate Malbec (Calchaquí Valley)
description: Concentrated savory aromas of prune, blackberry, compost and tree bark are not uncommon for Colomé. This is a clampy tannic Malbec that pulls down hard on the palate. Salty savory plum and berry flavors are oaky and finish with tannic residue. Drink through 2022.

title: Cristom 2014 Eileen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This tart, sleek, pretty wine shows bright strawberry and raspberry fruit. Quite young and fresh, it's still rather tight and stubbornly closed, even after breathing for a full 24 hours.

title: Dancing Crow 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Quite dry, crisp and lean, this wine is a great palate refresher that will pair well with raw oysters or goat cheese. It has bright citrus flavors, light body and a tangy finish.

title: Château Labégorce Margaux 2012 Zédé de Labégorce  (Margaux)
description: This second wine of Labégorce Margaux is named after the former neighboring estate Labégorce Zédé that was amalgamated after the 2009 vintage. This is a ripe wine, full of the fruit of the vintage as well as having a firm dry tannic structure that will allow it to age. With juicy blackberry fruits still so youthful, it is going to be ready drink from 2019.

title: Bernard Magrez 2014 Château Pérenne  (Médoc)
description: This is a lush succulent wine. It is full of ripe blackberry and black-plum fruits that are rich and superripe. Wood aging gives toast while licorice and bitter coffee flavors speak of some extraction. It is full-blown wine—sweet and juicy at the end.

title: Boeger 2014 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: Combining blackberry jam aromas with rich, ripe fruit flavors, this wine is medium to full bodied, and feels relatively easygoing for this grape variety.

title: Carson Scott 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: This mild-mannered wine doesn't show a lot of aromas, just light nutmeg and pear nuances, but opens up on the palate as Bosc pear, toasted almond and allspice pour out. The texture is smooth and soft and the finish tastes just slightly sweet.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Stones & Bones White (Lisboa)
description: This wine gets its name from the fossils that abound in the landscape of the vineyards. A blend of Arinto, Viognier and Chardonnay, it is ripe and perfumed. The texture is smooth, but with a mineral edge. Yellow fruits dominate the flavor profile that's balanced with acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Rainoldi 2012 Crespino  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: Aromas of wild rose, moist soil, Alpine herb and menthol lift out of the glass. The firm palate offers tart sour cherry, espresso, thyme and toasted hazelnut while tight fine-grained tannins provide the lean wiry framework. It closes on an astringent note.

title: Telmo Rodríguez 2015 Basa White (Rueda)
description: Apple, melon and other white-fruit aromas lead to a citrusy pulpy palate with good balance. Flavors of pithy citrus and green apple finish with a racy feel and notes of stone fruits and citrus peel. This is Verdejo with 10% Viura.
